Wolfblade::

She nodded. Her programs knew that making him choose one over the
other would be a bad thing to do. She hoped in her spark that in the
future, very soon in the future, that her spark would let go of him.
But for now it wanted him more than anything. And the mere mention of
him even wanting another made her circuit boards fry.  She forced
herself to smile and tried to be happy in the moment. "Alright."  She
lightly punched his shoulder. "TAG! Race you there."  And she took off
running. In mid stride she transformed back into wolf mode and ran as
fast as she could, feeling the wind on her faceplates. "Come on slow
poke, keep up!" she yelled back at him laughing. 



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote:
> Malice:
>  
> He smiled to her explaination, spending one on one time was always
good.  He was stopped in mid thought when she leaned in and planted a
kiss on his cheek.  She apologized, but there was no need, other than
she could not totally commit herself to loving him.  He placed his
hands on her shoulders, his own spark a bit unsteady.  He leaned in
and kissed her lips lightly, his faceplates trying to articulate it
correctly for her.
>  
> "Nothing to apologize for.  It's okay, I like speading time alone
with you too.  I know I should between you two, but I'm not sure it
would be such a great idea.  But please don't fight with her, don't
fight about me, it would hurt me deeply.  Maybe I can sort things out
and make a choice, but for now, let's just worry about work space
romance, hm?" he ended with a wink and a slight smile.
>  
> But he did mean it, if they forced him to choose... it might end
badly for all of them.
>
